department.dept_long_name: Department of Slavic Languages and Literatures

course.title: Mapping Cultural Space: Sites, Systems & Practices across Eurasia
course.faculty_text: Julie A. Buckler, Eve Marion Blau (Design School), and Kelly A. O'Neill-Uzgiris
course.description: Year-long bi-weekly interdisciplinary seminar on the production of social, cultural, and political space in Russia, Eastern Europe, and Central Asia. Physical and urban space will receive particular attention. Includes individual and collaborative work with digital tools for research, analysis, and presentation. Key questions: How can diverse mapping practices (geographical, scholarly and disciplinary, discursive, artistic) illuminate Eurasian cultural politics? How can we analyze cultural space as a dynamic product of cultural activity, as well as a framework for the evolution and transmission of beliefs, behaviors, memories, and values?
course.notes: Open to qualified undergraduates with permission of the instructors.
